abstract: Exxon Mobil said Monday that it has agreed to buy XTO Energy, a natural gas producer, for $31 billion in stock and the assumption of $10 billion in debt, in one of the biggest energy mergers of recent years.
snippet: Exxon Mobil said Monday that it has agreed to buy XTO Energy, a natural gas producer, for $31 billion in stock and the assumption of $10 billion in debt, in one of the biggest energy mergers of recent years.
lead_paragraph: Update | 9:20 a.m. The New York Times’s Jad Mouawad has more here.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil to Buy XTO Energy for $31 Billion

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Exxon Mobil said Monday that it has agreed to buy XTO Energy, a natural gas producer, for $31 billion in stock and the assumption of $10 billion in debt, in one of the biggest energy mergers of recent years.
snippet: Exxon Mobil said Monday that it has agreed to buy XTO Energy, a natural gas producer, for $31 billion in stock and the assumption of $10 billion in debt, in one of the biggest energy mergers of recent years.

headline.main: ExxonMobil to Buy XTO Energy for $41 Billion

abstract: The acquisition of XTO by Exxon is a bet on natural gas, a fossil fuel with reserves that are expanding in hard-to-reach areas.
snippet: The acquisition of XTO by Exxon is a bet on natural gas, a fossil fuel with reserves that are expanding in hard-to-reach areas.
lead_paragraph: Over the last decade, a handful of the nation’s small energy companies pulled off a coup. Right under the noses of the industry’s biggest players, they discovered huge amounts of natural gas in fields stretching from Texas to Pennsylvania.

headline.main: In Exxon Deal, Signs of the New Gusher

byline.original: By Jad Mouawad and Clifford Krauss

abstract: Exxon Mobil’s acquisition of XTO Energy amounts to a $31 billion wager on natural gas becoming the fossil fuel of choice for power generation in the United States.
snippet: Exxon Mobil’s acquisition of XTO Energy amounts to a $31 billion wager on natural gas becoming the fossil fuel of choice for power generation in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil‘s acquisition of XTO Energy amounts to a $31 billion wager on natural gas becoming the fossil fuel of choice for power generation in the United States. The huge deal brings the world’s largest energy company back home to focus on what could be an expensive and time-consuming effort — something it wouldn’t have considered just a few years ago.

headline.main: Behind Exxon Mobil’s Big Bet on Natural Gas

abstract: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday to acquire XTO Energy. By using its treasury shares to pay for XTO, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.
snippet: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday to acquire XTO Energy. By using its treasury shares to pay for XTO, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil finally unlocked its huge treasury share vault on Monday, snapping up XTO Energy in an all-stock transaction valued at $31 billion, plus the assumption of $10 billion in debt. By paying for XTO with its treasury shares, which it has built up slowly over the last decade, Exxon still has billions of dollars left over to spend.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil Opens  Its Huge War Chest

abstract: Exxon Mobil agreed to buy XTO Energy, a domestic producer of natural gas. The acquisition extends Exxon's bet that fossil fuels will remain a critical part of the nation's energy supplies for decades.
snippet: Exxon Mobil agreed to buy XTO Energy, a domestic producer of natural gas. The acquisition extends Exxon's bet that fossil fuels will remain a critical part of the nation's energy supplies for decades.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil agreed to buy XTO Energy, a domestic producer of natural gas. The acquisition extends Exxon's bet that fossil fuels will remain a critical part of the nation's energy supplies for decades.

headline.main: Exxon Mobil Will Buy XTO Energy
